alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 4:51PM PST until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 919 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Orange, Riverside, San Bernardino and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 919 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Rocks and mud on roadways in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 451 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, Moreno Valley, Oceanside, Carlsbad, Temecula, El Cajon, Vista, Redlands, San Clemente and Encinitas. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
